b2s_clf.ensemble package¶

Submodules¶

b2s_clf.ensemble.ensemble module¶

class b2s_clf.ensemble.ensemble.Ensemble(classifier_list, node_sizes, kwargs_list)[source]¶

Bases: object

fit(batch_list_train, batch_list_test, score_cap=0.5, get_best=None, verbose=False)[source]¶

Fits the ensemble with train and test batches by randomly picking couples and fitting a weak classifier from a list provided by the user. :param batch_list_train: Object of class vgc_clf.sampler.Sampler with training batches. :param batch_list_test: Object of class vgc_clf.sampler.Sampler with test batches. :param score_cap: Minimum accuracy of a weak classifier to be eligible. :param get_best: The number of best weak classifiers to keep. :param verbose: Whether to print progress on screen.

Returns:

predict(df, threshold=0.5, verbose=False)[source]¶

Classifies the instances of a batch of data contained in pandas.DataFrame into the positive or negative classes according to a certain probability threshold. :param df: pandas.DataFrame containing the batch of data to be classified. :param threshold: Float between 0 and 1 stating the probability threshold to label an instance as positive. :param verbose: Whether to print progress on screen.

Returns

numpy.array with class labels.

predict_proba(df, verbose=False)[source]¶

Return the probabilities that the instances of a batch of data stored in a pandas.DataFrame belong to the positive class. This data frame such contain compatible variable names. Note that the user will still have to make sure that such names refer to the right variables. :param df: pandas.DataFrame with data to predict. :param verbose: Whether to print progress on screen.

Returns

numpy.array with prediction probabilities.
